relating to an axon or axons (= thread-like structures attached to a nerve cell that send out signals away from the cell): These proteins regulate axonal growth during the development of the central nervous system. The growing end of a neuron receives the necessary materials by axonal transport from the cell body. axonal electrical activity
More examplesFewer examplesDiffuse axonal injury is one of the most common and devastating types of traumatic brain injury.Muscle wasting develops if axonal degeneration has occurred.The lesions appear to be closely associated with axonal disruption.We did not observe glial cells without any contact with axonal membranes.
